name: Amanda Bureau
description: Navigator, helmsman, and co-owner of the Springtide. Curvy woman of average height and copper-red hair.
lore: Was married to Beau Bureau on Oct 2, 2004 aboard the paddleboat Jubilee II wearing her great-grandmother's wedding gown.
Has been on several book covers.
Cosplays Victorian outfits.
Taught basic sailing to many new sailors, including Young Sierra and Rachel Crary.
Helmed the Springtide on most voyages.
Possesses excellent knowledge of weather; could predict storms or high winds hours ahead.

events.location: Met Beau Bureau in British Literature Class at Century College

events.details: Victorian photoshoot appeared on the cover of 'Thomas Jefferson's Daughters; Two White and One Black.'

name: Beau Bureau
description: Scion of the Bureau clan.  A tech engineer, sailor, and mentor.
lore: Was married to Amanda Bureau on Oct 2, 2004 aboard the paddleboat Jubilee II wearing her great-grandmother's wedding gown.
Has an amazing collection of hats.
Owns a suit of armor from the Ukraine.
Took a paycut to save his junior developers from layoffs.
Rigged a 20' pole to get better video of the Springtide.
Repaired the Springtide, built the Amanda Louise and Unicorn
Established the Binary Order and its code to do good through technology

events.details: Met Amanda Hunter in British Literature Class
Apprenticed under his father as an IT Manager/Developer.
hired as Lead Developer and IT Director.
first hired Young Sierra.  Famously asked her why she'd ever want to join IT.  She replies 'my mother told me to, Sir.'
Finished construction on the Amanda Louise, a 10' cat-rigged sailboat.

events.location: first hired Young Samantha as a coder
events.details: Hired Young Samantha. Demanded she be hired over other candidates as she was like him.  She solved a complex question regarding callibrating a weather station to a sailboat.

name: Mickey Slitts
description: Philosopher and poi-juggler aboard the Springtide
lore: Got a bachelor's with a dual major in chemistry and philosophy.
Created an AI that played Super Mario Bros.
Wore awesome leisure suits.
Often juggled poi balls on the bow of the Springtide, sometimes LED-lit balls during night sails.
Often took the tiller in high winds, loved the feel of the boat heeling.

events.details: Met Beau Bureau at work; first sailed aboard the Springtide.

name: Brian Anderzon
description: Philosopher and poi-juggler aboard the Springtide
lore: Played numerous instruments, including the hurdy gurdy and jaw harp.
Composed the Ballad of the Springtide, since lost to time.
Famously helmed the boat when, caught in a regatta, the Springtide flew around one of its bouys in an admirable fashion.
Spoke of an enormous snapping turtle he named Old Bruce

name: Young Sierra
description: First Mate aboard the Springtide.  Solidly built woman with red hair.
lore: Allegedly dragged Atlantis from White Bear as a show of strength.
Often insisted on cleaning Beau's office, regardless of anything he said.
Went to college on a soccer scholarship.

events.details: first worked for Beau Bureau as an IT intern.  He famously asked her why she'd ever want to join IT.  She replies 'my mother told me to, Sir.'
Bore a daughter she named Karver.

name: Robert Bureau
description: Co-owner of the Springtide, builder of the Amanda Louise and Bureau Manor.  An elderly man with grey hair.
lore: Caught in a storm on Lake Superior as a child.  Jumped into the raging waters to rescue another boat.  Saw the propeller of his boat rise out of the water and slam down in front of him.
Tried in vain to save a friend who had been shot in a hunting accident; rowing him miles across the water to get help.
Built Bureau Manor from the foundation; a sprawling estate of 5,000 sq ft with 4 total decks, porches and balconies.
Taught his children to code from a young age.
Not fond of cats.
Argued with various conservatives senators on the topic of gay rights, providing them with evidence that homosexuals make equally good parents.

name: Springtide
lore: Built in the 1980s by the O'Day Corporation.
Originally owned by an elderly couple in Duluth.
Purchased by Beau and Amanda Bureau in the 2000s
Renamed the Springtide for the tide that lifted boats off reefs.

name: Amanda Louise
lore: Built in 2016 by Beau and Bob Bureau
Named for Vice Captain Amanda Louise
